extendedIngredients.name: pyrex containers
extendedIngredients.originalString: Pyrex containers (I used an 8 piece 1 cup size 250ml found at Walmart)
metaInformation: (I used an 8 piece 1 cup size 250ml found at Walmart)

recipes.title: Crock-Pot Cupcakes

winePairing.pairingText: Cupcakes can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: Make Yellow Cake per instructions on box.You will begin to fill a few of the wrappers, I would double wrap them, filling them 3/4ths of the way up or so, but not too high.Pour about an 3/4ths inch or so of water into the crock.Put the Pyrex containers holding the wrappers directly into the crock.You can also use larger Pyrex containers that fit into your crock, the wrappers are not going to come out looking perfect regardless, often they get a little misshapen, but taste good just the same.If you really want to go all out you can attempt to find the silicone kind and then cut into them to make them fit a crock.The moisture is really what makes these stand out from other cupcakes.  These will not be beautiful cupcakes, but the taste will be different, and in my opinion, better then a traditional one because they are so much dense from the humidity created in the crock.Use some kind of utensil to prop the lid open a titch.Do not try and use a trivet, did that with one batch, and they would not cook.Cook on High for 3 hours, then check.On average I cooked them for 3 1/2, but 4 hours was too long.Frosting instructions:  With an Electric Mixer Mix Powder Sugar, Butter, Milk and Vanilla for 2 minutes on low until creamy.  If it seems stiff, add a titch more milk.Since I did Green and Yellow Frosting I took out a few scoops of it for the yellow and could add a few drops of yellow and hand mix.For the Green I had to add a ton of green to get that color.You will want to continue to use the mixer when trying to get that dark of a color, add some drops, mix, add some more drops, mix.

steps.step: Make Yellow Cake per instructions on box.You will begin to fill a few of the wrappers, I would double wrap them, filling them 3/4ths of the way up or so, but not too high.
Pour about an 3/4ths inch or so of water into the crock.

Put the Pyrex containers holding the wrappers directly into the crock.You can also use larger Pyrex containers that fit into your crock, the wrappers are not going to come out looking perfect regardless, often they get a little misshapen, but taste good just the same.If you really want to go all out you can attempt to find the silicone kind and then cut into them to make them fit a crock.The moisture is really what makes these stand out from other cupcakes.  These will not be beautiful cupcakes, but the taste will be different, and in my opinion, better then a traditional one because they are so much dense from the humidity created in the crock.Use some kind of utensil to prop the lid open a titch.Do not try and use a trivet, did that with one batch, and they would not cook.Cook on High for 3 hours, then check.On average I cooked them for 3 1/2, but 4 hours was too long.Frosting instructions:  With an Electric

Mix Powder Sugar, Butter, Milk and Vanilla for 2 minutes on low until creamy.  If it seems stiff, add a titch more milk.Since I did Green and Yellow Frosting I took out a few scoops of it for the yellow and could add a few drops of yellow and hand mix.For the Green I had to add a ton of green to get that color.You will want to continue to use the mixer when trying to get that dark of a color, add some drops, mix, add some more drops, mix.
